title: AI 101: What Models Actually Do
description: A plain-language mental model for how text, image, audio, and multimodal models generate outputs; what they can and can’t do.

title: Tokens, Context, Temperature, Top‑P (Without the Confusion)
description: Learn the knobs that change output quality and consistency, and when to adjust them for different tasks.

title: Hallucinations: Why They Happen and How to Reduce Them
description: Practical techniques to make AI more reliable: verification prompts, citations, uncertainty, and constraints.

title: Choosing the Right Model for the Job
description: Pick models based on task type (creative, coding, analysis, image) and your hardware budget; avoid common traps.

title: Local AI Basics: Running Models with Ollama
description: Install, run, and manage models locally; where files live; how to run multiple prompts safely.

title: Local AI Basics: LM Studio Quickstart
description: Use LM Studio for local inference, model downloads, and simple server mode for tools.

title: Offline‑First AI Workflows (No Cloud Required)
description: Design a reliable workflow that works when the internet is down: prompts, files, and repeatable runs.

title: Local AI Performance: What Actually Speeds Things Up
description: Understand batching, context size, quantization, and why some settings dramatically slow down generation.

title: CPU vs GPU vs NPU: What Each Does for AI
description: A practical guide to what CPUs, GPUs, and NPUs are good at in AI, and what to expect on consumer hardware.

title: VRAM vs RAM: The Bottlenecks That Decide What You Can Run
description: Why VRAM matters for models, what RAM does, and how to avoid crashes and slowdowns.

title: Quantization Explained (Q4/Q5/Q8) and Why It Matters
description: Understand quantization levels, accuracy tradeoffs, and how it changes speed and memory needs.

title: Budget AI Hardware Paths (Realistic Home Builds)
description: Cost-effective upgrade paths, used GPU considerations, power/thermals, and “good enough” builds.

title: NPUs & Edge AI: What’s Real vs What’s Hype
description: Where NPUs help, where they don’t, and what you can realistically do without enterprise gear.

title: Prompting as a System: Roles, Constraints, and Formats
description: Stop prompt roulette. Learn a repeatable structure that works across models and tasks.

title: Output Formatting: JSON, Checklists, and Self‑Validation
description: Force consistent outputs using schemas, validators, and step-by-step “verify then answer” patterns.

title: Prompt Debugging: Fix Bad Outputs Fast
description: Diagnose why a prompt failed and apply targeted changes that improve results immediately.

title: Self‑Checking with Rubrics: Make AI Grade Its Own Work
description: Use rubrics and scoring to improve quality without building full agent systems.

title: Compare Two Outputs: Picking the Better Result (and Why)
description: Learn a quick method to judge outputs for accuracy, constraint-following, and usefulness.

title: Context Is Not Memory: Why AI “Forgets”
description: Understand context windows vs memory and how to keep AI aligned over long tasks.

title: RAG: When It Helps and When It Hurts
description: A practical decision guide: when retrieval boosts accuracy and when it makes things worse.

title: File‑Based Knowledge: Organizing Notes for AI to Use
description: Simple folder and document patterns that help both you and AI find the right info quickly.

title: Image AI Prompting Basics: Consistency Over Randomness
description: Build prompts that reliably produce a consistent subject, style, and composition.

title: Civitai 101: How to Read Model Pages and Choose Wisely
description: Understand checkpoints, LoRAs, triggers, example settings, and how to avoid junk downloads.

title: Image Pipelines: Iteration, Variations, and Style Locking
description: A repeatable workflow to refine images while keeping identity, style, and quality stable.

title: Video AI Basics: What’s Possible Today (and Limits)
description: A practical overview of video generation, common artifacts, and how to plan better prompts and shots.

title: Storyboarding for Video AI: Shot Lists That Improve Results
description: Use shot lists, camera language, and constraints to turn vague prompts into coherent sequences.

title: Text‑to‑Speech Basics: Natural Voice Without the Drama
description: Understand TTS quality factors, voice stability, and clean scripts for great narration.

title: Audiobook Pipeline: From Script to Chapters to Files
description: A practical process for generating and organizing audio output with consistent volume and pacing.

title: AI‑Assisted Coding Workflow (Safe and Repeatable)
description: How to use AI on real projects: diffs, constraints, and verifying changes without chaos.

title: Debugging with AI: From Error Log to Fix Plan
description: Use AI to interpret logs, propose fixes, and validate outcomes systematically.

title: Testing with AI: Generate Useful Tests and Edge Cases
description: Create tests that actually catch bugs, including edge cases and regressions.

title: Code Review with AI: Catch Issues Before They Ship
description: Use AI as a reviewer: readability, safety, performance, and correctness checks.

title: Agentic AI: What Agents Are (and When They’re Overkill)
description: A grounded definition of agents, tools, loops, and the situations where simple prompts are better.

title: Human‑in‑the‑Loop Loops: Automate Without Losing Control
description: Build a safe loop where AI proposes, you approve, and the system tracks progress and errors.

title: Generate → Judge → Fix: The Simplest Agentic Loop
description: A minimal quality loop that boosts outputs using scoring and targeted revisions.

title: Safe Use & Risk: Privacy, Permissions, and Common Pitfalls
description: Practical safety: what not to upload, how to protect personal data, and sane defaults.

title: Copyright & Licensing Basics for AI Assets
description: Understand licenses, attribution, and how to share models/assets responsibly.
